announcement.title: CE Status August 2016
announcement.summary: CE Mission for the last 16 years has come to a wonderful conclusion.

announcement.title: Save the Date for CE Luncheon Fundraising
announcement.summary: Our worthy cultural exploration activities are made possible because of your gener­ous support. We cannot wait to share these accomplishments with you. Please mark your calendar for Sunday, September 20th to attend.

announcement.title: CE 2015 Talent Registration Ends Tomorrow
announcement.summary: 2015 CE Talent Registration deadline is tomorrow March 2, 2015. The competition will be held on March 22 from 9am to 2pm followed by an one-hour awards ceremony at Chief Sealth International High School.

announcement.title: CE 2015 Tour Application Deadline Is Near
announcement.summary: 2015 CE Tour application deadline is March 10, 2015. We are planning on sending 4 teachers in the summer of 2015. All K-12 teachers from the Greater Seattle area interested in enhancing their China-related teaching components are welcome to apply.

announcement.title: Welcome to the new CE Website!
announcement.summary: Come tour the site and explore CE activities for students, teachers and the community! Check out the new contents, easy navigation and streamlined registration process!

announcement.title: 2014 CE Tour Application Starts on 01/15/2014
announcement.summary: Please preview our 2014 tour application information. The online application will be open from 1/15/2014 through 2/28/2014.

announcement.title: Language & Talent Competition
announcement.summary: The much appreciated Chinese Language and Talent Competition is scheduled for March 23, 2014. Use the newly improved online registration and reserve your spot early!

announcement.title: Thank you for Supporting CE
announcement.summary: The September CE Friendship Fundraising Luncheon was a sounding success. We raised over $25,000. Please check out the different ways to support CE while making new friends, learning new skills and having fun!

announcement.title: Resource Center
announcement.summary: Please check out the curriculum plans and tour experiences provided by the 2013 CE teachers.

announcement.title: A teacher journey to China
announcement.summary: Siri Hulbert, Shorecrest High School World Language teacher and department chair, is participating in a cultural-exchange trip sponsored by the Cultural Exploration of Greater China Foundation. This is a community-based organization founded by the Seattle Chinese School.

tile.title: For Students
tile.text:
Language and Talent Competition
Join us in March for this statewide event for K-12 students to share Chinese language learning & cultural experience.
Learn more...

tile.title: For Teachers
tile.text:
Cultural Exploration Tour Deadline:3/10/15
Devoted to promote better understanding of Greater China & Chinese culture through educational tours in the summers.
Learn more...

tile.title: For the Community
tile.text:
Resource Center
Network communities to facilitate cultural exchange activities & provide web-based repository of curriculum plans & ideas.
Learn more...
